page.title: 02SCHOOLS - STUBBINS/EDENFIELD
page.content: In our area there are two schools. One is{Stubbins County Primary},and the other is{Edenfield Church of {England Primary}. Our present school building is only 15 years old,but the school was originally founded in 1868 in an old stone building nearby.In our school there are 140 children in six classes. Edenfield C.E. Primary School is over 100 years old,and is still in its original building at the northern end of the village.There are 90 children in four classes. When they reach the age of 11 most children from both schools transfer to the High School in Haslingden 3 miles away,though some children also go to schools in Ramsbottom,Bury,Bolton, Blackburn or Accrington.
